09 Every Time I Try
10 Our Love Is Gonna Live Forever



Spain's second album She Haunts My Dreams contains more of the dreamy, lounge-tinged pop that made their first album The Blue Moods of Spain a critical and cult favorite. Songs like "Nobody Has to Know" feature Josh Haden's smoky vocals and moody arrangements and continue Spain's compellingly melancholy direction.
Forget all those best albums of '99 lists you've read elsewhere this is the finest album of the year. If you like your music with a melancholy ache that coils around you like the whispering ghost of a lost lover thenthis is for you. It conjures up the spirit of Will Oldham, Leonard Cohen or even a mimimalist Tindersticks but underlying Josh Haden's tender, broken voice is an understated and gorgeous jazz texture - heartbreaking lullabyes for the darkness closing. And they seem to be Swedish!.
